components.description:
An emoji version of the digit 3, created via a variation selector.

Not given emoji presentation on Apple or Microsoft devices, or on platforms such as Facebook and Twitter / X. Microsoft did previously support this emoji within Windows 8 and Windows 10.
components.title: Digit Three

components.description: An emoji component character that may appear as a square with rounded corners on certain platforms.
components.title: Combining Enclosing Keycap

description: The number 3 on a square with rounded corners, designed to look like a keycap.
title: Keycap Digit Three

version.description: The following characters we added to Unicode in 1999, with most being given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: Keycap Digit Three was approved as part of Unicode 3.0 in 1999 and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/keycap-digit-three/
emoji_net_data.name: keycap: 3

bn:00085859v: To determine the number (of objects in a group).
Determine the number or amount of

bn:00058285n: A concept of quantity involving zero and units
Mathematical object used to count, label, and measure
A number is one of several related types of mathematical objects.
A member of one of several classes: natural numbers, integers, rational numbers, real numbers, complex numbers, quaternions.
A set of numerals for representing numbers.

bn:00000100n: One one of a group of three.
The cardinal number occurring after two and before four, represented in Roman numerals as III, in Arabic numerals as 3.
The cardinal number that is the sum of one and one and one
3 is a number, numeral, and glyph.
One of a group of three.
Grammatical number related to precisely 3 objects of the same type

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the '3' keycap emoji is rendered with a crisp, white numeral set against a deep blue background, its edges softly rounded for a modern feel. Apple's signature glossy 3D shading gives the keycap a tactile, almost clickable appearance, inviting interaction. This emoji is commonly used to represent the number three, ordinal positions, or as a simple numerical indicator in digital communication.
